name: Free-Fi.Org
body: ### Free-Fi **NEVER** use open unsecured WiFi. EVER. [Identity theft](https://www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/cyber/identity_theft) is one of the fastest growing crimes. If you use a wireless network [WiFi](http://dilbert.com/strip/2015-06-21) that does not use a password, your private information can be stolen by anyone. ### Use "Free-Fi" as the default password Most WiFi modern networks today can offer **WPA2** security, which means that even if the password is public, then other people can not access your data. (Note: A dedicated hacker MAY be able to steal your session on initial connection, but this is still safer than NO password). If you go to a coffee shop or library that has an open and unsecured WiFi, then please ask them to set a password. I suggest that the default password for all wireless networks should be "Free-Fi". This means the wireless network is participating in "Free-Fi" and Follow @jsON
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
